p: All prepared EP-NEs formulations had acceptable droplet sizes, ranging from 32.81 nm to 48.41 nm, with a narrow PDI, in the range of 0.160 to 0.240 ( Table 1). PDI correlates the standard deviation of the droplet size with the calculated mean size, which is a criterion for the uniformity of size distribution within the NE formulation [ 20]. The small PDI values indicate that the systems are mono-dispersed, have a narrow particle size distribution, and have a higher degree of stability [ 42]. Further investigation of the results showed that the oil content had a significant positive effect on droplet size, which could be explained by the increased viscosity of the mixture due to increased drug concentration. Surfactant and/or S mix did not have an effect on droplet size, mainly due to the proximity of the applied SAA concentration in the optimized systems.
